lead_paragraph: Under FIFA’s system, the smallest country has the same voting power as the biggest, and payments from FIFA for projects help to ensure allegiance to Sepp Blatter.

headline.print_headline: How a Speck in the Sea Became a FIFA Power
headline.main: How the Cayman Islands Became a FIFA Power

snippet: Under FIFA’s system, the smallest country has the same voting power as the biggest, and payments from FIFA for projects help to ensure allegiance to Sepp Blatter.
abstract: Impractical and somewhat improbable decision by FIFA, soccer world's governing body, to build its headquarters on Cayman Islands points to outsize authority wielded by some FIFA officials; Caymans have become central to scandal that has engulfed FIFA, and plan to build there underscores iron grip of power held by president Sepp Blatter even as organization faces accusations of rampant corruption.
